verses.roman:
hateṣu sarvānīkeṣu
nṛpo bārhadrathas tadā
upekṣito bhagavatā
magadhān durmanā yayau

synonyms: hateṣu—having been killed; sarva—all; anīkeṣu—the soldiers of his armies; nṛpaḥ—the king; bārhadrathaḥ—Jarāsandha, the son of Bṛhadratha; tadā—then; upekṣita h—neglected; bhagavatā—by the Supreme Lord; magadhān—to the Magadha kingdom; durmanāḥ—depressed; yayau—he went.
translation: All of his armies having been killed, and himself neglected by the Personality of Godhead, King Jarāsandha, son of Bṛhadratha, then sadly returned to the kingdom of the Magadhas.
